title: Video games lead to children being bullied and scorned, says Children's Commissioner
text:
Video games are leading to children being bullied and humiliated in the playground, a report by the Children’s Commissioner has found.

Researchers discovered children were being “scorned” if they did not have the latest digital outfits for their characters in video games such as Fortnite.

Anne Longfield said children were “open to exploitation” because firms had designed the games to encourage children to spend ever more money improving the performance and appearance of their characters or teams.

Simone Vibert, senior policy analyst at the Children’s Commissioner’s Office and author of the report, said: “We found that children felt pressure to buy Fortnite skins to avoid being seen as 'the poor...
description: Video games are leading to children being bullied and humiliated in the playground, a report by the Children’s Commissioner has found.
